sense.name: a specific desire of someone
sense.commentary: WISH[+state][+mental][+desire] Note: refers to an agent's internal state of desire or preference Note: does not imply a request of another party (see Sense 2)
sense.examples: Her wish to see a total eclipse was finally realized. The union has reiterated its wish for an agreement with management. It is their wish to continue organizing such fundraisers.

sense.name: an indirect request to do something
sense.commentary: WISH[+event][+speech_act][+request][+indirect] Note: implies an indirect agent is making the request of another party expressed in the sentence.
sense.examples: It is the king's wish that we accompany him to the ball this evening. She is trying to carry out her late father's wishes.

sense.name: an invocation of good fortune
sense.commentary: WISH[+event][+speech_act][+invocation][+fortune][+good] Note: usually occurs in the plural
sense.examples: They send along their good wishes to you. Sally made a wish and blew out her birthday candles.

sense.name: the thing that is preferred or desired
sense.commentary: WISH[+relation][+role][+preference] Note: equates WISH with an event or object, WISH BE X, WISH OF X
sense.examples: John eventually got his wish of a white Christmas. This palace was the wish of an eccentric 19th-century prince.
